description: Giants upon whose shoulders we stand.

slides.title: Isaac Newton (1643-1727)
slides.content:
# The Unifier üçé

English Physicist/Mathematician.
- **Laws of Motion**.
- **Gravity**.
- **Calculus**.
- **Optics** (Prisms).
Often considered greatest scientist ever.

slides.title: Albert Einstein (1879-1955)
slides.content:
# The Genius üß†

German Theoretical Physicist.
- **Theory of Relativity**.
- $E=mc^2$.
- **Photoelectric Effect** (won Nobel for this, not relativity).
- Redefined gravity and time.

slides.title: Marie Curie (1867-1934)
slides.content:
# Radioactive ‚ò¢Ô∏è

Polish-French Physicist/Chemist.
- Discovered **Radium** and **Polonium**.
- Coined "Radioactivity".
- First woman to win Nobel. Only person to win in two sciences.

slides.title: Charles Darwin (1809-1882)
slides.content:
# The Naturalist üê¢

English Biologist.
- Voyage of the Beagle.
- **Theory of Evolution by Natural Selection**.
- Changed how we see our place in nature.

slides.title: Galileo Galilei (1564-1642)
slides.content:
# Father of Modern Science üî≠

Italian Astronomer.
- Championed **Heliocentrism**.
- Studied speed and velocity.
- Persecuted for truth.

slides.title: Prize Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Who is the only person to win Nobel Prizes in two different scientific fields?

slides.title: Nikola Tesla (1856-1943)
slides.content:
# The Wizard ‚ö°

Serbian-American Inventor.
- **AC Current** (The modern grid).
- Induction  Motor.
- Radio (Marconi got credit, but Tesla invented basics).
- Died penniless.

slides.title: Ada Lovelace (1815-1852)
slides.content:
# First Programmer üë©‚Äçüíª

English Mathematician.
- Worked with Babbage on Analytical Engine.
- Wrote the first algorithm intended for a machine.
- Saw computers could do more than math (music, art).

slides.title: Louis Pasteur (1822-1895)
slides.content:
# Germs ü¶†

French Chemist.
- **Pasteurization**.
- **Germ Theory**.
- Vaccines for Rabies and Anthrax.

slides.title: Alan Turing (1912-1954)
slides.content:
# Computer Father üíª

English Mathematician.
- Cracked Enigma Code (WW2).
- **Turing Machine** (Concept of computer).
- **AI** (Turing Test).
- Persecuted for being gay.

slides.title: Niels Bohr (1885-1962)
slides.content:
# Quantum Architect ‚öõÔ∏è

Danish Physicist.
- **Bohr Model** of atom (Electrons in orbits).
- Pioneer of Quantum Mechanics.

slides.title: Rosalind Franklin (1920-1958)
slides.content:
# DNA Photographer üß¨

British Chemist.
- **Photo 51**: X-ray image that proved DNA double helix.
- Died young; Watson & Crick got the Nobel.

slides.title: Code Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Biographer Andrew Hodges called him the 'founder of computer science'. Who broke the Enigma code?

slides.title: Stephen Hawking (1942-2018)
slides.content:
# Cosmology ‚ôø

British Physicist.
- **Black Holes** emit radiation (Hawking Radiation).
- Brought physics to masses (*A Brief History of Time*).
- Example of mind overcoming body (ALS).

slides.title: Dmitri Mendeleev (1834-1907)
slides.content:
# The Table üìä

Russian Chemist.
- Created **Periodic Table**.
- Genius move: Left gaps for elements not yet discovered (Germanium, Gallium) and predicted their properties.

slides.title: Jane Goodall (1934-Present)
slides.content:
# Primatologist ü¶ç

British Ethologist.
- Studied Chimps in Tanzania.
- Discovered Chimps make tools (redefined "Human").
- Conservationist.

slides.title: Carl Sagan (1934-1996)
slides.content:
# The Communicator üåç

American Astronomer.
- "Cosmos" TV series.
- Pale Blue Dot.
- Search for ET (SETI).
- Inspired a generation.

slides.title: Top Scientists Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- **Newton/Einstein**: Physics.
- **Darwin**: Biology.
- **Curie/Pasteur**: Medicine/Chem.
- **Turing/Lovelace**: Computing.
- Diversity of minds advancing humanity.
